title: Russian patriotism and military spirit are instilled in children from pre-school
subhead: Since Russia's invasion of Ukraine in February 2022, the Kremlin has encouraged 'cadet' programs at schools in the country for children from the age of 4, who learn to march, obey orders and handle weapons.

title: Thailand and Cambodia agree to new ceasefire after weeks of deadly border fighting
subhead: The truce halts all military action along the disputed frontier after nearly a month of clashes that killed at least 47 people and displaced more than one million civilians.

title: 'We have to know a lot of things that the French don't': Migrants face new residence permit tests
subhead: A new 'civic exam,' which will be required to obtain long-term residence permits or citizenship from January 1, 2026, has begun to be rolled out in some approved centers.

title: How dining etiquette reveals social divides among young people

Mariupol, Ukraine: A model city of 'new Russia'
subhead: Since 2015, photographer Gabriele Micalizzi has been documenting the Donbas region from the Russian side of the front line, an area where Moscow enforces very strict access conditions for journalists. In November, he secured permission to enter Donetsk Oblast, a region of occupied Ukraine, and traveled to Mariupol, a city destroyed by Russian forces in 2022, which has since been colonized and rebuilt in record time.
byline: By Gabriele Micalizzi  (Mariupol (Ukraine), photographer) and Benjamin Quénelle

title: Six thousand new perfumes in 2025: Why manufacturers are flooding the market
subhead: The perfume sector is experiencing a global consumption revolution: Young people are collecting bottles, and Chinese consumers are buying more and more. With L'Oréal leading the way, perfume has become the main sector driving the cosmetics industry.

title: Semiconductors: Nvidia at the heart of the new Pacific battle
subhead: 'Microchips: The Oil of the 21st Century' (1/5):  Whether it's AI, electronics or defense, the 'silicon economy' drives the entire industrial and service sectors. It is at the heart of a fierce battle between global powers, with China seeking to free itself from dependence on US technologies.
byline: By Harold Thibault (Beijing (China) correspondent) and Arnaud Leparmentier (San Francisco (United States) correspondent)
